article.headline: Temple 75, Charlotte 61
article.story: PHILADLEPHIA (AP) -- Dionte Christmas scored 19 points and sparked a second-half spurt as Temple defeated cold-shooting Charlotte 75-61 Wednesday night. Reserve guard Ryan Brooks had 16 points and Lavoy Allen added 12 for Temple (15-12, 8-5 Atlantic 10), which lost 60-58 at Charlotte on Jan. 12. Lamont Mack had 19 points and Charlie Coley 11 for the 49ers (15-12, 6-7), who hit on only 22 of 70 shots (31.4 percent) in suffering their first double-digit loss of the season. With Temple leading 37-32 three minutes into the second half, Christmas scored five quick points to start a 14-4 run, giving the Owls a 51-36 lead with 11:50 to play. From that point on, Charlotte never got closer than 11 points. Charlotte's leading scorer, senior guard Leemire Goldwire, averaging 18.9 points, had a career-low 3 points, making only 1 of 9 field goal attempts in 26 minutes along with a free throw.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
